newsitem.title: USA: Flextronics to take charge, sees profit.
newsitem.headline: Flextronics to take charge, sees profit.

text.p: Flextronics International Ltd said Wednesday that it expects to take charges and restructuring costs in the range of $5 to $7 million and that it expects to be "modestly profitable" in the third and fourth quarters of fiscal 1997.
Flextronics said in a release Wednesday that in line with its refocusing of manufacturing efforts, it will be closing its Richardson, Texas, facility and downsizing its Singapore facility.
The company said that it will be "nearly doubling" its manufacturing capacity overall to a total of 720,000 square feet over the next year at its facilities in California, China, Europe and Mexico.

Flextronics also said that it will add to its direct sales force in the United States, Europe and Asia, and reorganize sales efforts to support its client base. It added that it will open sales offices in Germany, France and Sweden.
